title: 1,100 Flights Cancelled In US As Microsoft Outage Disrupts Operations
content: Air passengers around the United States faced delays, while some airlines halted flight operations as Microsoft-based computers ceased to work after a global outage on Friday.
summary: Air passengers around the United States faced delays, while some airlines halted flight operations as Microsoft-based computers ceased to work after a global outage on Friday.

title: Melania Trump Makes Rare Appearance At Republican National Convention
content: Donald Trump's elusive wife Melania made a rare appearance at the Republican National Convention in support of Donald Trump's third bid for the White House, but broke with decades of tradition by not speaking at the event.
summary: Donald Trump's elusive wife Melania made a rare appearance at the Republican National Convention in support of Donald Trump's third bid for the White House, but broke with decades of tradition by not speaking at the event.

title: Iran Capable Of Producing Fissile Material For Nukes In "1 Or 2 Weeks": US
content: Iran is capable of producing fissile material for use in a nuclear weapon within "one or two weeks," US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Friday.
summary: Iran is capable of producing fissile material for use in a nuclear weapon within "one or two weeks," US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Friday.

title: Bangladesh Imposes Curfew, Deploys Military As 105 Die In Protests
content: Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's office on Friday announced the imposition of a nationwide curfew and the deployment of military forces to keep order after days of deadly student protests.
summary: Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's office on Friday announced the imposition of a nationwide curfew and the deployment of military forces to keep order after days of deadly student protests.

title: Tesla Halted Some Production Lines Due To Global IT Outage: Report
content: Tesla halted some production lines due to the global IT outage, Business Insider reported on Friday, citing sources familiar with the matter.
summary: Tesla halted some production lines due to the global IT outage, Business Insider reported on Friday, citing sources familiar with the matter.

title: Zuckerberg "Not Planning" To Endorse Biden Or Trump In US Presidential Polls
content: Mark Zuckerberg said that former President Donald Trump's immediate reaction after being shot was "badass" and inspiring, and helps explain his appeal to voters.
summary: Mark Zuckerberg said that former President Donald Trump's immediate reaction after being shot was "badass" and inspiring, and helps explain his appeal to voters.

title: Vietnamese Most Powerful Communist Party Leader Nguyen Phu Trong Dies At 80
content: The general secretary of Vietnam's Communist Party Nguyen Phu Trong -- considered the country's top leader -- died on Friday aged 80, his party said.
summary: The general secretary of Vietnam's Communist Party Nguyen Phu Trong -- considered the country's top leader -- died on Friday aged 80, his party said.

title: "No Unity": Families Of Israeli Hostages Divided On How To Secure Release
content: The families of hostages grabbed by Hamas gunmen on October 7 noisily agree they want the captives home but are split on how best to achieve it.
summary: The families of hostages grabbed by Hamas gunmen on October 7 noisily agree they want the captives home but are split on how best to achieve it.

title: New York City Council Member Allegedly Bites Cop During Protest, Arrested
content: Ms Zhuang was protesting the construction of a new homeless shelter at the corner of 25th Avenue and 86th Street in Bensonhurst on Wednesday.
summary: Ms Zhuang was protesting the construction of a new homeless shelter at the corner of 25th Avenue and 86th Street in Bensonhurst on Wednesday.

title: "This Gave A Seizure To...": Musk On Microsoft CEO's Update On Outage
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has responded to the biggest tech outage in history after millions of Windows users worldwide experienced the Blue Screen of Death. The outage was caused by an update to CrowdStrike 'Falcon Sensor'.
summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has responded to the biggest tech outage in history after millions of Windows users worldwide experienced the Blue Screen of Death. The outage was caused by an update to CrowdStrike 'Falcon Sensor'.

title: Adidas Drops Pro-Palestinian Bella Hadid From Ad Referencing Munich Olympics
content: Adidas said Friday it had dropped vocal pro-Palestinian model Bella Hadid from an advertising campaign for retro sneakers referencing the 1972 Munich Olympics, which were overshadowed by a massacre of Israeli athletes.
summary: Adidas said Friday it had dropped vocal pro-Palestinian model Bella Hadid from an advertising campaign for retro sneakers referencing the 1972 Munich Olympics, which were overshadowed by a massacre of Israeli athletes.

title: Russia Jails US Reporter Evan Gershkovich For 16 Years For "Espionage"
content: US reporter Evan Gershkovich was sentenced by a Russian court on Friday to 16 years prison for "espionage", a verdict slammed as "despicable", "disgraceful" and a "sham" by Western governments and his employer.
summary: US reporter Evan Gershkovich was sentenced by a Russian court on Friday to 16 years prison for "espionage", a verdict slammed as "despicable", "disgraceful" and a "sham" by Western governments and his employer.

title: Biden "Absolutely" Staying In US Presidential Race, Says His Campaign Chair
content: US President Joe Biden is "absolutely" staying in the race for the White House, his campaign chair said Friday, despite mounting pressure from Democratic allies to step aside over worries about his age and health.
summary: US President Joe Biden is "absolutely" staying in the race for the White House, his campaign chair said Friday, despite mounting pressure from Democratic allies to step aside over worries about his age and health.

title: "Decision Of Lies": Israel PM Netanyahu On World Court's Palestine Order
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the International Court of Justice made a "decision of lies" on Friday by ruling Israel's occupation of the Palestinian territories illegal.
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said the International Court of Justice made a "decision of lies" on Friday by ruling Israel's occupation of the Palestinian territories illegal.

title: Israel's Occupation Of Palestinian Territory "Illegal": UN Top Court
content: Israel's decades-long occupation of the Palestinian territories is illegal and needs to end "as rapidly as possible", the UN's top court said Friday.
summary: Israel's decades-long occupation of the Palestinian territories is illegal and needs to end "as rapidly as possible", the UN's top court said Friday.

title: In Pics: Bangladesh On Fire, Buildings, Vehicles Burnt Amid Ongoing Clashes
content: Violent clashes broke out between students and cops in Bangladesh last month over the newly reinstated reservation system for hiring in civil services. Around 64 people have been killed in this week due to clashes.
summary: Violent clashes broke out between students and cops in Bangladesh last month over the newly reinstated reservation system for hiring in civil services. Around 64 people have been killed in this week due to clashes.

title: CrowdStrike CEO Says "Deeply Sorry" For Tech Outage: Report
content: CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz apologized for a global tech failure that disrupted multiple industries on Friday, vowing to work with all of its customers as they work to get their operations back online.
summary: CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz apologized for a global tech failure that disrupted multiple industries on Friday, vowing to work with all of its customers as they work to get their operations back online.

title: Protesters Set Jail On Fire In Bangladesh, Free "Hundreds" Of Inmates
content: Bangladeshi student protesters stormed a prison and freed hundreds of inmates Friday as police struggled to quell unrest, with huge rallies in the capital Dhaka despite a police ban on public gatherings.
summary: Bangladeshi student protesters stormed a prison and freed hundreds of inmates Friday as police struggled to quell unrest, with huge rallies in the capital Dhaka despite a police ban on public gatherings.

title: Taiwan Woman Makes Daughter Walk Barefoot On Hot Pavement, Internet Angry
content: Instead of buying her new shoes, she forced the girl to walk barefoot on the scorching asphalt road for at least 20 minutes.
summary: Instead of buying her new shoes, she forced the girl to walk barefoot on the scorching asphalt road for at least 20 minutes.

title: How World Scrambled To Deal With Massive Microsoft Outage: 10 Points
content: Airlines, banks and businesses across the world were scrambling today to deal with one of the biggest IT crashes in recent years, caused by an update to an antivirus program. The US grounded all planes briefly; flights in other nations were affected.
summary: Airlines, banks and businesses across the world were scrambling today to deal with one of the biggest IT crashes in recent years, caused by an update to an antivirus program. The US grounded all planes briefly; flights in other nations were affected.
